result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent L Beard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vincent L Beard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vincent L Beard was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

01:34 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 



On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1  . 


  Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #    2 
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve  90 days  in the DCJ, with Huber cc to 20CF1289

-Stayed for 12 months   probation cc to 20CF1289

CONDITIONS:
-Provide DNA sample
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2 
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Days credit for time served:  zero days
-Days credit if revoked: zero days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Lindsey B/emailed to DOC

3/7/22 CORRECTION:
DA surcharge remitted per clerk. -jly.
Status conference on March 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:15 AM Defendant appeared.  Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn has atty Cuevas on another case, anticipates him being appointed on this case. Court sets STC for 3/10. Defn expected to have counsel by that hearing. Court finds good cause to exceed time limits for next STC.
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with OKM. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

04:05 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
